title: 7 Bollywood-Verified Outfits To Wear When It’s Not Exactly Cold, Or Hot
text: facebook 638 SHARES Staring at fat centre-spreads of magazines, we’ve all wondered what transitional wardrobes are. You know that annual, uncomfortable lull between winter and spring when your relationship with the weather worsens? So does your tolerance for the inept silhouettes that don’t deliver. Well, that’s the “transition” the high guards of fashion keep talking about. It may not be a familiar phenomenon,but it sure is a familiar feeling. Slipping into a pair of boots feels too warm, yet strapping on a foot-baring flat, a tad too naked. So, how do you layer right when it’s a thin line between balmy and nippy? Well, our Bollywood ladies seem to have found the middle ground on this issue. 1. Wear your all-white summer staples, but do keep your denim jacket right by your side, just in case the weather decides to switch gears (which it will). stylebyami/via Instagram 2. Swap the standard tucked-in cardigan with the longer, rich-girl ones, like Huma Qureshi. Follow suit and pair it with a pleated monochrome skirt. sanjanabatra/via Instgram 3. A quarter-sleeved, calf-length dress should be your go-to silhouette, if you wish to combat the seasonal flu and still look cool AF. afashionistasdiaries/via Instagram 4. Long cover-ups go a long way when you can’t decide if you need a cardigan or a coat. afashionistasdiaries/via Instagram 5. Throw over a snug cardigan over your cool-girl dress, so that you can switch between the hot and cold winds like a boss. afashionistasdiaries/via Instagram 6. Trade your longer lengths for a cute 60s mini to go with your fancy, going-out sweater. sanjanabatra/via Instgram 7. Pick a shift dress, and layer it under a cute shirt so that the occasional cold winds don’t spoil your sass.
